1    | /***************************************************************
2    | $Header: /djgpp/sv2agw/agwpe_if.c 1.0 Fri 07-21-2000 3:53:22 pm $
3    | 
4    | FILE: agwpe_if.c
5    | DESC: Interface between libsock and AGWPE/TCP
6    | HIST: 20000712 V0.1
7    | ****************************************************************/
8    | 
9    | /*+ Normal includes  +*/
10   | #include <stdio.h>
11   | #include <stdlib.h>
12   | 
13   | /*+ Includes for network functionality  +*/
14   | #include <netinet/in.h>
15   | #include <sys/socket.h>
16   | #include <netdb.h>
17   | #include <arpa/inet.h>
18   | #include <unistd.h>
19   | 
20   | #ifdef DJGPP
21   | #include <lsck/lsck.h>
22   | #else
23   | #define lsck_perror perror
24   | #endif
25   | 
26   | #include <fcntl.h>		/*+ For fnctl() -> non-blocking  +*/
27   | 
28   | /*+ Include own header files  +*/
29   | #include "fortify.h"
30   | #include "ringbuf.h"
31   | #include "agwhdr.h"
32   | #include "agwpe_if.h"
33   | #include "agwsubs.h"
34   | 
35   | /*+ Local variables +*/
36   | static unsigned short port;		 /*+ TCP IP portnumber to use  +*/
37   | static unsigned long int host;	 /*+ Host address  +*/
38   | static int agwpe_sock;			 /*+ Socket number which will be assigned for communcation to AGWPE +*/
39   | 
40   | /*+ External variables +*/
41   | extern int agwpe_status;
42   | 
43   | /*+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
44   | DESC: setup the tcp connection to AGWPE							   
45   | ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++*/
46   | int 
47   | agw_tcp_init(char *address,    	/*+ Host name or IP address to use +*/
48   |              char *p)			/*+ Port number to use +*/
49   | /*+ Returns 1 on success, 0 on failure +*/
50   | {
51   |   struct sockaddr_in in;
52   |   struct hostent *hostlookup;
53   | 
54   |   printf("\nagw_tcp_init()");
55   | 
56   |   /* Host name lookup */
57   |   port = (unsigned short) atoi ( p );
58   |   hostlookup = gethostbyname(address);
59   |   if (hostlookup == NULL) {
60   |     herror("agw_tcp_init()");
61   |     exit(EXIT_FAILURE);        
62   |   }
63   |   host = ( (struct in_addr *) hostlookup->h_addr)->s_addr;
64   |   free(hostlookup);
65   | 
66   |   /* Initialize sockets */
67   |   memset ( &in, 0, sizeof ( struct sockaddr_in ) );
68   | 
69   |   if ( ( agwpe_sock = socket ( AF_INET, SOCK_STREAM, 0 ) ) == -1 ) {
70   |     perror("agw_tcp_init");
71   |     return(0);
72   |   }
73   | 
74   |   in.sin_family = AF_INET;
75   |   in.sin_port = htons ( port );
76   |   in.sin_addr.s_addr = host;
77   | 
78   |   if ( connect ( agwpe_sock, (struct sockaddr *)&in, sizeof ( struct sockaddr_in ) ) == -1 )
79   |     {
80   |       perror ( "connect" );
81   |       return(0);
82   |     }
83   | 
84   |   return(1);
85   | }
86   | 
87   | 
88   | /*++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
89   | Description: Close socket used for the connection to AGWPE
90   | +++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++*/
91   | void 
92   | agw_tcp_close(void)
93   | {
94   |   static int first_time = 1;
95   | 
96   |   /*--- Check if this function is called fro the first time  */
97   |   if (!first_time)
98   |     return;
99   | 
100  |   /*--- Close the socket and exit this program  ---*/
101  |   (void) close (agwpe_sock);
102  |   first_time = 0;
103  | 
104  | #if defined(USE_FORTIFY)
105  |   Fortify_ListAllMemory();
106  |   // Fortify_OutputStatistics();
107  | #endif
108  | 
109  | 
110  | }
111  | 
112  | /*+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
113  | Send a command to the AGW Packet Engine over the tcpip socket.
114  | This version knows of sending the header only.
115  | 
116  | Returns 1 on success,
117  |         exits on a failure.
118  | ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++*/
119  | void 
120  | agw_tcp_send(BYTE *data,	/*+ AGWPE header, containing the command +*/
121  |              size_t size)	/*+ Size of the data to send (inclusive header +*/
122  | {
123  |   if (!(agwpe_status & AGWPE_ACTIVE)) {
124  |     printf("agw_tcp_send(): No connection to AGWPE");
125  |     return;
126  |   }
127  | 
128  |   /*--- No data to send  */
129  |   if (size == 0)
130  |     return; 
131  | 
132  |   /*--- Send command over the socket  ---*/
133  |   if ( send ( agwpe_sock, data, size, 0 ) <= 0 ) {
134  |     perror ( "agw_tcp_send()" );
135  |     exit (EXIT_FAILURE);
136  |   }
137  | }
138  | 
139  | /*+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
140  | Description: Get data from the socket and store it
141  | in the ring buffer. The socket number used is a global 
142  | variable.
143  | ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++*/
144  | void
145  | get_tcp_data (RINGBUF *ringbuf)		/*+ Pointer to ringbuf +*/
146  | {
147  |   #define BUFSIZE 256 	/*+ This is a static size for now +*/
148  |   BYTE buf[BUFSIZE];    
149  |   int t = 0;         
150  |   int i;
151  |   size_t size = (size_t)(BUFSIZE-1);
152  | 
153  |   /*@-unrecog@*/	/*--- Suppress LCLINT warning message  */
154  |   /*--- Only now set socket in nonblock mode  */
155  |   (void) fcntl(agwpe_sock,F_SETFL,O_NONBLOCK);
156  | 
157  |   /*@+matchanyintegral@*/  /*--- Avoid LCLINT warning  */
158  |   while ((t = recv ( agwpe_sock, buf, (size_t) size, 0 )) > 0) {
159  |     if (t == -1) {
160  | 	  if (errno == EWOULDBLOCK) 
161  | 	    continue; 
162  | 	  else
163  | 	    break;
164  | 	}
165  |     buf[t] = '\0';
166  |     /*--- Store incoming data in own ring buffer  ---*/
167  |     for (i=0 ; i<t ; i++) {
168  | 	  ringbuf_put(ringbuf,buf[i]);
169  | 	}
170  |   }
171  |   /*@=matchanyintegral@*/	/*--- Restore original LCLINT value */
172  | }
173  | 
174  | /*+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
175  | Description: This function checks if ther are enough
176  | databytes in the ringbuffer to contain a AGWPE header
177  | 
178  | Returns: 0 if no header available,
179  |          1 if there is enough data to contain a header
180  | ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++*/
181  | int 
182  | agwhdr_available(RINGBUF *ringbuf)	/*+ Pointer to ringbuffer to use +*/
183  | /*+ Returns 0 if no header was available, 1 if there is enough data
184  | in the buffer to contain a header +*/
185  | {
186  |   if (ringbuf_cnt(ringbuf) < sizeof(AGWPE_HDR)) {
187  |     return(0);
188  |   }
189  |   else
190  |     return(1);
191  | }
192  | 
193  | 
194  | /*+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
195  | Description: Get AGWPE data out of the ringbuffer
196  | ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++*/
197  | int 
198  | agwdata_get(RINGBUF *buf,	/*+ Pointer to the rignbuffer +*/
199  | 			size_t  cnt, 	/*+ Number of bytes to get out of buffer +*/
200  | 		    BYTE *d)	    /*+ Pointer to buffer to store the data in +*/
201  | /*+ Returns 1 on success, 0 if no data was available +*/
202  | {
203  |   int i;
204  |   BYTE c;
205  | 
206  |   if (!(agwpe_status & AGWPE_ACTIVE)) {
207  |     printf("agwdata_get(): No connection to AGWPE");
208  |     return(0);
209  |   }
210  | 												 
211  |   /*--- Check if there is a header available  ---*/
212  |   if (ringbuf_cnt(buf) < cnt) {
213  |     perror("agwdata_get() Less then requested bytes in ringbuf"); 
214  |     return(0);
215  |   }
216  | 
217  |   for (i=0 ; i < (int)cnt ; i++) {
218  |     (void) ringbuf_get(buf,&c);  
219  | 	d[i] = c;
220  |   }
221  |   return((int)cnt);
222  | }
223  | 
224  |
